page.title: 12COWS
page.content: Our breed of cow is a British Friesian and can be easily recognised by its black and white markings. We try to ensure that each cow produces one calf every year in the November to September period. Any female claves (heifers) are reared and eventually join the dairy herd at about 2.5 years old.These replace older cows which have to be slaughtered because they are no longer economic to keep through thier inability to produce a calf, chronic lameness or any disease which affects their milk output performance. All bull calves are kept for four weeks, on a diet of milk powder. After four weeks they go to market where they are purchased by other farmers to be fattened and slaughted as prime beef. By Samantha D
